moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 e6 3. a3 c5 4. Nf3 Nc6 5: White gave me a solid expansion on the queenside, but it has its dangers. Anyway, it "can't" be bad...
moves.9. Nc3 Bd6: I sensed my knight would have been needed on the queenside, so I prepare to castle while developing and controlling e5. d6 would have been wiser. I didn't want to play d5, though solid, because my lsb wants its diagonal.
moves.10. b3 Na5 11. bxc4 Nxc4 12. Bxc4 bxc4: the g column would be a weakness for me, I know.
moves.13. O-O Nd5: No use Qa5, because of Bd2.
moves.14. Ne2 Qc7: c3 was useless after e4. f5, to stop it, was vey dangerous - or I thought so.
moves.16. e5: Be7 and yawn. So let's try something else.
moves.16... Bxf3 17. exd6: I hoped he would take with the g pawn, but of course not...
moves.17... Bxe2 18. Qxe2 Qxd6: Well, a pawn is a pawn. c4 is in no inmediate danger, but white found...
moves.19. c3 Nd5 20. Qg4: wonderful, and unexpected. I cannot castle, nor defend. But I "had" to go for something more than Rg8...
moves.20... O-O-O: Just crazy. I knew I would threatened on the b column, but I was tempting him to take g7, and put my rooks on a good open line.
moves.21... f6 22. a4: unavoidable. I have to play with great care, since I'm going to lose, here.
moves.22... g5 23. a5: A loss of tempo, but ok. The good one for white was g3, since it allows Ba3 and my queen must go to c6... but i didn't see a catastrophe in it.
moves.23... h5: I should have provided squares for my king with Rd8-somewhere. I was just shooting in the dark. If white doesn't take advantage quickly of its advantage, he must have faced a pawn storm.
moves.25. Qxf4: i'm not sure gxQ is better or not, but I saw a sequence aimed to put my knight on b5 (yes)
moves.26... Ne2+ 27. Kh1 Nxc3 28. Rfc1 Nb5: ...but my knight is very well placed, here.
moves.29. Rxc4+ Kb7 30. Bc5: the bishop in b6 isn't too dangerous.
moves.33... axb5 34. Rxb5+ Ka7: Not allowing a check and Rxe6.
moves.35. dxc5: yes, but the pawns are not connected, and I have a whole rook.
moves.35... Rhd8 36. Rb2: white blundered, but he was lost anyway. the pawns will fall, and I will win with a full rook.
